content: whale amigurumi pattern by ambroscrochet every part of the whale is worked in rounds - do not join at the end of each round finished size approximately 10 5 cm 4 inches yarn i use 100% acrylic yarn - schachenmayr bravo to be precise you can use whatever colors and yarn work for you crochet hook 3 mm you will also need pins scissors tapestry needle or needle and thread 10 mm or 12 mm safety eyes or needle and black thread if you wish to embroider the eyes toy stuffing abbreviations and stitches used magic_ring single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase decrease = decrease fasten_off = f/o chain = chain → how to read the pattern round x we are working on round x → x single_crochet increase/decrease * y the instructions between parentheses have to be repeated y times x single_crochet increase/decrease means we will work one single_crochet in each x stitches and then work one increase or one decrease into the next stitch for example 3 single_crochet increase * 6 means work one single_crochet in each of the next three stitches one increase in the fourth stitch repeat six times → x single_crochet increase/decrease work one single_crochet in each of the x stitches then work one increase/decrease in the next stitch if you have any questions you can reach me on instagram @robiambros or on facebook @ambroscrochet make sure to tag me if you post pictures of your finished amigurumi if you need a refresher on some stitches i have a series of tutorials on my igtv where you will also find a series of videos on how to make this amigurumi if you feel like supporting my patterns you can do so through my ko-fi 1 body start with a chain of 9 round 1 starting from the 2nd chain from the hook 1 single_crochet in each of the next 7 chain 3 single_crochet in
